greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: Stirling2 triangle with scaled diagonals (powers of 7).
comment: This is a lower triangular infinite matrix of the Jabotinsky type. See the D. E. Knuth reference given in A039692 for exponential convolution arrays.
The row polynomials p(n,x) := Sum_{m=1..n} a(n,m)x^m, n >= 1, have e.g.f. J(x; z)= exp((exp(7*z) - 1)*x/7) - 1.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
mathematica: Flatten[Table[7^(n - m) StirlingS2[n, m], {n, 11}, {m, n}]] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1, 11, for(m=1, n, print1(7^(n - m) * stirling(n, m, 2),", ");); print();) \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 02 2002
